trg_text: Key Cabinet decisions Cabinet approved the plans to set up the Operation Phakisa Mining Lab, which will identify a set of concrete problems that are limiting the growth and developmental impact of the secto The Mining Lab will also collaboratively develop plans to overcome these challenge A four-week Mining Lab is scheduled for October 2012.

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e gore sethalwa sa Leano la Ekonomi ka ga Diphedi t e di fapafapanego se phatlalat we go tla go fiwa ditshwaotshwao ke set hab Leano le le akaret a lebaka la nako la mengwaga ye 14 leo le felago ka 2030.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the publishing for public comments of the draft Biodiversity Economy Strateg The strategy covers the period of 14 years ending 2030.

src_text: Leano le nyaka go oket a seabe sa lefapha la Diphedi t e di fapafapanego go Letseno ka Moka la ka Nageng mola ka go le lengwe le babalela phedi ano ya diphedi ka mo nagen Le tla re gareng ga t e dingwe la lebeledi i a go maatlafat a ekonomi ka go bobedi bophelo bja diphoofolo t a nageng le ka lefapheng la boeti bja mabapi le tlhag Kabinete e dumelet e gore sethalwa sa tlhako le mokgwa wa go hlama Seabe se se tlago Laolwa maemong a Boset haba sa Afrika Borwa se phatlalat we go tla go fiwa ditshwaotshwao ke set haba ka nepo ya go reri ana le bakgathatema pele ga ge se ka romelwa go Kopanokgothekgothe ya Tlhako ka ga Phetogo ya Klaemete ya Mokgatlo wa Dinagakopano (UNFCC).Tlhako ye ge e
trg_text: The strategy seeks to increase biodiversity s contribution to the Gross Domestic Product whilst conserving the country s ecosysteIt will among other things, focus on enhancing growth in both wildlife and ecotourism sector Cabinet approved the publishing for public comments of the draft framework and approach for the formulation of South Africa s Intended Nationally Determined Contribution for consultation with stakeholders ahead of its submission to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC).The framework once fully consulted will form of the legal agreement under the UNFCCC, which will be adopted in Paris, France in December 201 BillsCabinet approved the publishing of the following Bills for public comments: Border Management Agency

src_text: et e e rerilwe ka botlalo ke bakgathatema e tla opa tumelelano ya semolao ka fase ga UNFCC, yeo e tlago amogelwa ka Paris, France ka Manthole 201 MelaokakanywaKabinete e dumelet e go phatlalat wa ga Melaokakanywa ye e latelago go tla go fiwa ditshwaotshwao ke set haba: Molaokakanywa wa Setheo sa Taolo ya Mellwane (BMA), wa 2015, wo o nyakago go hloma BMA ye e tlago lekanyet a maeto a go putla mellwane ya dinaga, go nolofat a kgwebi ano le dilo t e bohlokwa t a polokego ya naga, ka gare ga kamano ya ditlamego t a selete sa Afrika Borwa, sa Afrika le sa bodit habat habTaolo ye e tee ya phethagat o ya molao wa mellwane e fa monyetla wa ditirelo t eo di sa turego kudu gammogo le polokego ye e maatlafadit wego le taolo ya tikologo ya mellwan Molaokakanywapheto wa wa Bafaladi, wa 2015, wo o nyakago go hloma tshepedi o ya tiri o ya phethagat o ya mo omo ye e nago le bokgoni le ya go
trg_text: (BMA) Bill, 2015, which seeks to establish the BMA that will balance secure cross-border travel, trade facilitation and national security imperatives, within the context of South Africa s regional, African and international obligationThis single authority for border law enforcement provides the potential for more cost- effective services as well as enhanced security and management of the border environmen Refugees Amendment Bill, 2015, which seeks to create a more efficient and effective functioning application process for asylum seekerCabinet further approved the submission of the following Bills to Parliament: Local Government: Municipal Electoral Amendment Bill, 2015, which amends the Local Government: Municipal Electoral Act, 2000 (Act 27 of 2000).The amendments address issues with a view to ensuring smooth preparation and execution of the 2016 local government election Unemployment Insurance Amendment Bill, 2014.
